ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per study, describing basic and extended study properties.

ns:column.ns:description: The long/friendly name of each study.
The container of each study.
A unique string ID for each study.
Whether the study uses visits, relative dates, or continuous dates. TimepointType may be VISIT, DATE, or CONTINUOUS.
The start date of each study. Note that subjects can also have start dates.
The end date of each study.
The number of days an automatically created timepoint should span.
Security type for each study, indicating how dataset read/write access is determined.
The ID of the study dataset that contains data for automatic subject cohort assignment.
The name of the property/field in the subject cohort dataset that contains the subject's cohort name.
Whether each study uses manual (versus automatic) cohort assignment.
Whether data without an assigned QC state should be considered public. Applies only in studies where QC states are configured.
The default quality control state to be applied to data imported via the pipeline.
The default quality control state to be applied to assay data copied to each study.
The default quality control state to be applied to data manually edited within the study.
Whether private data (as indicated by the data's quality control state) is visible by default.
Whether each study can be reloaded from disk-based files.
How frequently automatic reloads of each study should take place.
The timestamp of the most recent study reload.
The user who initiated automatic reload.
Whether advanced cohort assignment is enabled. Advanced cohort support allows subjects to change cohorts over time.
The ID of the study dataset that contains data for subject-level comments.
The default property/field within the Subject Comment dataset that should be displayed in specimen and dataset views.
The ID of the study dataset that contains data for subject/visit-level comments
The default property/field within the Subject/Visit Comment dataset that should be displayed in specimen and dataset views.
The singular noun used to identify subjects. Examples include "Participant", "Mouse", or "Yeast". This value cannot be changed after study creation.
The plural noun used to identify subjects. Examples include "Participants", "Mice", or "Yeasts". This value cannot be changed after study creation.
The column header for subject IDs. Examples include "ParticipantId", "MouseId", or "YeastId". This value cannot be changed after study creation.
A short description of the study.
Format of description.
The entity id used to generate the attachment parent for the study protocol document.
The entity id of the study container from which this study was derived. Will be null if a study is not an ancillary study.
The investigator of the study.
The grant for the study.
The species of the subjects in the study.
Optional prefix to use when generating random alternate participant IDs.
Number of digits to use when generating random alternate participant IDs.
RowId of the row in StudySnapshot that contains the settings used when creating this snapshot. Null if the study is not a snapshot.
Timestamp of the last specimen load.
Whether to allow Repository locations to be Requesting Locations.
Whether to allow Clinic locations to be Requesting Locations.
Whether to allow Site Affiliated Lab locations to be Requesting Locations.
Whether to allow Endpoint Lab locations to be Requesting Locations.
Name of the dataset that contains participant alias data, if any.
Name of the column in the selected participant alias dataset that contains the source value.
Name of the column in the selected participant alias dataset that contains the alias value.
The description of the assay plan for the study.
Flag to perform query validation after import.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per study-affiliated location. Locations can include labs, clinics, and repositories.

ns:column.ns:description: The unique identifier for each location.
The external identifier for each location, if imported from an external data source.
The unique LDMS identifier assigned to each location, if imported from an LDMS system.
The unique Labware identifier assigned to each location, if imported from a Labware system.
The upload code for each location.
Whether each location is a site-affiliated laboratory.
Whether each location is a repository.
Whether each location is an endpoint laboratory.
Whether each location is a clinic.
The long/friendly name of each location.
A short description of each location.
The street address of each location.
The city or town of each location.
The governing district (i.e. state, province, federal district) of each location.
The country of each location.
The postal area code (i.e. zip, postcode) of each location.
A unique string identifier for each location.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per defined visit in a study.

ns:column.ns:description: A string type code for each visit.
The long/friendly name of each visit.
An integer value used to sort visits in display order.
Whether each visit should be displayed by default in study views and queries.
The ID of the study dataset that maps from study dates to study visit IDs.
The unique integer row ID of each visit.
The maximum sequence number associated with each visit.
The minimum sequence number associated with each visit.
The expected day for this visit according to the protocol, used for study alignment.
The ID of each visit's cohort, if it is cohort specific.
An integer value used to sort visits chronologically.
A short description of the visit.
The rowId of the visit.
The name of the visit tag.
The ID of the cohort, if the visit/tag combination is cohort specific.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row of metadata per study dataset.

ns:column.ns:description: A URI/LSID uniquely identifying each dataset's type.
The label to be presented to users for each dataset.
The category of each dataset.
Describes the type of the dataset, defaults to 'standard'.
The display order of each dataset.
Whether each dataset should be displayed by default in study queries.
A unique string identifier for each dataset.
The name of the property/field identifying the visit date in each dataset.
The name of the property/field identifying the additional key column of each dataset.
Whether the additional key column of each dataset is managed by the server (either as RowId or GUID/EntityId, versus provided during import), or is None.
The name of each dataset.
The description of each dataset.
Whether each dataset contains demographic data, which is keyed only on Subject ID (versus non-demographic data keyed on Subject ID and visit).
The ID of each dataset's cohort, if it is cohort specific.
The unique ID of the assay design associated with each dataset, if the data is assay-associated.
The timestamp of the last modification of this dataset.
An additional field to provide flexible categorization of data
Controls sharing of dataset rows across folders: NONE,ALL,PTID

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per specimen request.

ns:column.ns:description: The user who created each request.
The timestamp of request creation.
The user who last modified each specimen request.
The timestamp of the last modification of each specimen request.
The ID of the current status of each request.
All comments associated with each request. These comments include all initial values from the new request form.
The ID of the selected destination location for each request.
Whether each request is for system use only.
A unique string identifier for each request.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per subject.

ns:column.ns:description: Subject identifier
The enrollment location of each subject.
The current location of each subject.
The start date for each subject.
The current cohort assignment of each subject. For studies with advanced cohort support enabled, this corresponds to the cohort assignment from the last chronological visit.

The initial cohort assignment of each subject. For studies with advanced cohort support enabled, this corresponds to the cohort assignment from the first chronological visit. For studies without advanced cohort support, this will be equal to the current cohort assignment.
A randomly generated date offset for this participant. This can be used to shift each participant's date values when publishing a study.
A randomly generated alternate participant ID. This can be used in place of internal particiapnt IDs when publishing a study.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per possible sample request status.

ns:column.ns:description: The unique ID of each status.
The sort order of each status, when displayed in drop-downs in the UI.
The label of each status.
Whether each status is a final state. Final states indicate that no further processing is expected.
Whether specimens in requests in each status are locked. Locked specimens cannot be requested by other users.
A string value uniquely identifying the subject/visit combination for each dataset row.
Subject identifier
Date record/form was created
Last time record/form was modified

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per study quality control state.

ns:column.ns:description: The short label of each quality control state.
The full description of each quality control state.

Whether data in each quality control state is considered public. Public data is displayed by default to all users with read permissions to the study. Non-public states can be used to hide suspect or pre-QC data from some users.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per specimen request/vial combination, used for mapping vials to requests.

ns:column.ns:description: The ID of the specimen request.
The global unique ID of the vial.
Whether the vial identified in each mapping has been removed from the specimen/vial tables.

ns:table.ns:description: One row per vial in the specimen tracking system.

ns:column.ns:description: A string value that uniquely identifies the specimen/draw-level properties of the vial, including subject, visit, and specimen type.
The ID of the primary specimen associated with each vial.
The global unique ID of each vial. Assumed to be globally unique within a study, but duplicates can exist cross-study.
The volume of each vial.

The primary/original volume of each vial. This value is passed through from the specimen data feed, so the provided data determines whether this is primary volume per vial or primary volume per collection/draw.
The units of the primary volume value of each vial. For example, cells or milliliters.

Whether or not each vial should be requestable. If null, requestability will be determined by whether the vial is at a repository or locked in another request. If true/false, repository calculation is overridden, and only locked status will be considered.

The ID of the current location of the vial. Current location is determined by the most recent event for each vial, and may be null if the most recent specimen event indicates that the vial has been shipped.
Whether each vial is currently at a repository.
Whether each vial is currently locked in a specimen request.
Whether each vial is currently available for request. Calculated from the Requestable, AtRepository, and LockedInRequest columns.
The ID of the processing location of each vial.
The value of the ProcessedByInitials from the first recorded event for this vial.
Text explanation for why each vial is or is not available for request. May be null if the vial is available and no special circumstances apply.
The total cell count for each vial.
Additional comments on processing quality from latest event.
Additional comments on processing quality from latest event.
The type of vial.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per primary specimen collection/draw.

ns:column.ns:description: A string value uniquely identifying the subject/visit combination for each specimen row.
The ID of the subject providing each specimen.
The timestamp of specimen collection.
The date of specimen collection.
The time of specimen collection.
The timestamp of specimen receipt at the site-affiliated laboratory.
A string value that uniquely identifies the specimen/draw-level properties of the specimen, including subject, visit, and specimen type.
The class, network, or study associated with each specimen.
The visit value (sequence num) of specimen collection.
The protocol associated with each specimen.
A description of the visit type for each specimen. For example, "visit", "day", or "week".
The units of volume for each specimen.
The sub-additive/derivative type of each specimen.
The ID of the primary type of each specimen.
The ID of the derivative type of each specimen.
The ID of the additive type of each specimen.
The ID of the originating (collection) location of each specimen.
The ID of the second derivative type of each specimen.
The number of vials from each specimen that are currently at a repository.
The number of vials from each specimen that are currently available for request.
The total volume of all vials from each specimen that are currently available for request.
The total volume of all vials from each specimen that are expected to become available for request. This includes vials currently available as well as those not available but not yet requested.
The number of vials from each specimen that are currently locked in requests.
The total volume of all vials from each specimen.
The total number of vials from each specimen.
The ID of the processing location of each vial.
The common FirstProcessedByInitials value for all vials in this specimen. Will be null if all vials do not share a common FirstProcessedByInitials values.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per vial in the specimen tracking system.

ns:column.ns:description: A unique ID of each vial.
The ID of the specimen/collection/draw for each vial.
The global unique ID of each vial. Assumed to be globally unique within a study, but duplicates can exist cross-study.
The ID of the subject providing each specimen.
A string value uniquely identifying the subject/visit combination for each specimendetail row.
The timestamp of specimen collection.
The date of specimen collection.
The time of specimen collection.
The timestamp of specimen receipt at the site-affiliated laboratory.
A string value that uniquely identifies the specimen/draw-level properties of the vial, including subject, visit, and specimen type.
The class, network, or study associated with each specimen.
The visit value (sequence num) of specimen collection.
The protocol associated with each specimen.
A description of the visit type for each specimen. For example, "visit", "day", or "week".
The units of volume for each specimen.
The sub-additive/derivative type of each specimen.
The ID of the primary type of each specimen.
The ID of the derivative type of each specimen.
The ID of the additive type of each specimen.
The ID of the originating (collection) location of each specimen.
The ID of the second derivative type of each specimen.

The primary/original volume of each vial. This value is passed through from the specimen data feed, so the provided data determines whether this is primary volume per vial or primary volume per collection/draw.
The units of the primary volume value of each vial. For example, cells or milliliters.
The number of vials from each specimen that are currently at a repository.
The number of vials from each specimen that are currently available for request.
The total volume of all vials from each specimen that are currently available for request.
The total volume of all vials from each specimen that are expected to become available for request. This includes vials currently available as well as those not available but not yet requested.
The number of vials from each specimen that are currently locked in requests.
The total volume of all vials from each specimen.
The total number of vials from each specimen.
The volume of each vial.

Whether or not each vial should be requestable. If null, requestability will be determined by whether the vial is at a repository or locked in another request. If true/false, repository calculation is overridden, and only locked status will be considered.

The ID of the current location of the vial. Current location is determined by the most recent event for each vial, and may be null if the most recent specimen event indicates that the vial has been shipped.
Whether each vial is currently at a repository.
Whether each vial is currently locked in a specimen request.
Whether each vial is currently available for request. Calculated from the Requestable, AtRepository, and LockedInRequest columns.
The ID of the processing location of each vial.
The value of the ProcessedByInitials from the first recorded event for this vial.
Text explanation for why each vial is or is not available for request. May be null if the vial is available and no special circumstances apply.
The total cell count for each vial.
The type of vial.
Additional comments on processing quality from latest event.
Additional comments on processing quality from latest event.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per primary specimen collection/draw.

ns:column.ns:description: The unique identifier of each specimen.
The ID of the subject providing each specimen.
A string value uniquely identifying the subject/visit combination for each specimensummary row.
The timestamp of specimen collection.
The date of specimen collection.
The time of specimen collection.
The timestamp of specimen receipt at the site-affiliated laboratory.
A string value that uniquely identifies the specimen/draw-level properties of the vial, including subject, visit, and specimen type.
The protocol associated with each specimen.
The class, network, or study associated with each specimen.
The visit value (sequence num) of specimen collection.
A description of the visit type for each specimen. For example, "visit", "day", or "week".
The total volume of all vials from each specimen.
The units of volume for each specimen.
The ID of the primary type of each specimen.
The ID of the derivative type of each specimen.
The ID of the additive type of each specimen.
The sub-additive/derivative type of each specimen.
The number of vials from each specimen that are currently locked in requests.
The number of vials from each specimen that are currently at a repository.
The number of vials from each specimen that are currently available for request.
The total volume of all vials from each specimen that are expected to become available for request. This includes vials currently available as well as those not available but not yet requested.
The total number of vials from each specimen.
The total volume of all vials from each specimen that are currently available for request.
The ID of the originating (collection) location of each specimen.
The ID of the second derivative type of each specimen.
The ID of the processing location of each vial.
The common FirstProcessedByInitials value for all vials in this specimen. Will be null if all vials do not share a common FirstProcessedByInitials values.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per specimen additive.

ns:column.ns:description: The unique ID of each specimen additive.
The external identifier for each additive, if imported from an external data source.
The LDMS additive code.
The Labware additive code.
The name/label of each additive.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per specimen derivative.

ns:column.ns:description: The unique ID of each derivative.
The external identifier for each derivative, if imported from an external data source.
The LDMS derivative code.
The Labware derivative code.
The name/label of each additive.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per specimen event. An event is a logged storage location for a vial, generally corresponding to one event per clinic, repository, and/or laboratory.

ns:column.ns:description: The unique ID of each event.
The external identifier for each event, if imported from an external data source.
The ID of the vial.
The ID of the location associated with each event.
The unique specimen ID provided by the LIMS at the storage location.
The parent specimen ID provided by the LIMS at the storage location.
The location-specific storage code.
The location-specific storage flag.
The date/time of vial storage.
The location-specific shipment flag.
The shipment batch number, if the vial/specimen has left this location.
The date/time of shipment, if the vial has left this location.
The ID of the import batch that included this vial/specimen.
The date/time of vial receipt.
Location-specific comments associated with each vial.
The condition code for the vial.
A text identifier of the collection/draw. This value may vary by location/LIMS, so it should not be used to group events cross-location.
The LIMS-provided sample origin.
The LIMS-provided external location.
The date/time of last record modification in the external LIMS.
Alternate specimen ID, if needed.
The LIMS-provided expected time value.
The LIMS-provided expected time units.
The group/protocol of each vial.
The LIMS system responsible for each event. Generally used when multiple LIMS (LDMS and Labware, for example) are providing loading data into a single repository.
A text identifier of the collection/draw. This value may vary by location/LIMS, so it should not be used to group events cross-location.
The date/time each vial was shipped from the lab.
The date/time each vial was shipped to the lab.
The ID of the subject providing each specimen.
The timestamp of specimen collection.
The timestamp of specimen receipt at the site-affiliated laboratory.
The class, network, or study associated with each specimen.
The visit value (sequence num) of specimen collection.
The protocol associated with each specimen.
A description of the visit type for each specimen. For example, "visit", "day", or "week".
The volume of each vial.
The units of volume for each specimen.
The sub-additive/derivative type of each specimen.
The ID of the primary type of each specimen.
The ID of the derivative type of each specimen.
The ID of the additive type of each specimen.
The ID of the second derivative type of each specimen.
The ID of the originating (collection) location of each specimen.
The duration of the freezing process.
The duration of the processing process.

The primary/original volume of each vial. This value is passed through from the specimen data feed, so the provided data determines whether this is primary volume per vial or primary volume per collection/draw.
The units of the primary volume value of each vial. For example, cells or milliliters.
The initials of the vial's processor.
The date/time of vial processing.
The total cell count for each vial.
The type of vial.
Indicates the event precedes the last edit of the vial.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per primary specimen type.

ns:column.ns:description: The unique ID of each primary type.
The external identifier for each primary type, if imported from an external data source.
The LDMS code for each primary type.
The Labware code for each primary type.
The name/label of each primary type.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per subject/visit combination in the study. Note that this table is populated dynamically as specimen, assay, and dataset data are loaded, and is guaranteed to always be complete.

ns:column.ns:description: Subject identifier
The date of the visit. Primarily used in date-based studies.
A string value uniquely identifying the subject/visit combination for each subject/visit row.
The ID of the visit.
The sequence number of the visit. Primarily used in visit-based studies.
The day of the visit. Primarily used in date-based studies.
The ID of the subject's cohort during each visit. Useful only when advanced cohort assignment is enabled.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per defined plate template or uploaded plate instance.

ns:column.ns:description: The unique admin-provided name of each plate template (""NAb: 5 specimens in duplicate", for example).
Boolean indicating whether each plate is a template versus an uploaded instance of a plate template.
The number of rows in each plate.
The number of columns in each plate.
A unique text identifier (a GUID) for the data file associated with each plate.
A text label of the plate type ("NAb", for example).

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per uploaded well data or defined plate template well.

ns:column.ns:description: The data value associated with each well.
This well's dilution/concentration value.
The row ID of the plate with which each well is associated.
The zero-based row index of each well.
The zero-based column index of each well.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per well group in uploaded plate data or plate templates.

ns:column.ns:description: The row ID of the plate with which each well group is associated.
The name of each well group.
The type of each well group. For example, "CONTROL", "REPLICATE", or "SPECIMEN".
Boolean indicating whether each well group is part of a plate template (versus a plate instance).
Description of the assay.
Whether or not to show this records in the lookup drop-down for newly created study designs.
Target of this specific assay. For example, "Antibody", "T-Cell", or "Humoral".
Target object of the assay. For example, "T-Cell".
Subtype of the target type. For example, "CD4" or "CD8".
Platform on which the assay was performed. For example, ""ELISpot", “ELISA”, “Luminex” or "Flow Cytometry".
Type of experiment that the assay represents. For example, "Immunogenicity", "Epidemiology", or "Cell Engineering".
What is being measured. For example, "Neutralization", "Activation", or "Inhibition".
Email address for the main point of contact for questions about this assay.
Shorter version of the full description, usable in a table of contents view.
The set of key words submitted with the associated paper.
Description of why this assay is important to the dataspace.
An alternate way of referring to the assay.
The lab responsible for creating this assay.
The principal investigator for the lab.
Whether or not to show this records in the lookup drop-down for newly created study designs.
Whether or not to show this records in the lookup drop-down for newly created study designs.
Whether or not to show this records in the lookup drop-down for newly created study designs.
Description of the lab, primary goals, focus, notable discoveries.
Email address for the principal investigator for the lab.
Shorter version of the full description, usable in a table of contents view.
The institution at which the lab is based and/or affiliated with.
Whether or not to show this records in the lookup drop-down for newly created study designs.
Whether or not to show this records in the lookup drop-down for newly created study designs.
Whether or not to show this records in the lookup drop-down for newly created study designs.
Whether or not to show this records in the lookup drop-down for newly created study designs.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per defined cohort.

ns:column.ns:description: The unique ID of the cohort.
The friendly name/label of the cohort.
Determines whether participants belonging to this cohort are considered enrolled in the study.
The expected or target number of subjects for a given cohorts in the study.
A short description for the cohort.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per vial-level specimen comment.

ns:column.ns:description: The unique ID of the specimen comment.
A string value that uniquely identifies the specimen/draw-level properties of the vial, including subject, visit, and specimen type.
The global unique ID of each vial. Assumed to be globally unique within a study, but duplicates can exist cross-study.
The date/time of comment creation.
The ID of the user who created each comment.
The date/time of the most recent comment modification.
The ID of the user who last modified each comment.
The text of each comment.
Whether this comment is associated with a quality control alert.
Whether the quality control flag of this comment was forced by a specimen administrator. Forced comments will not be changed during specimen import, even if quality control issues come or go.
Quality control-associated comments. Set by the system to indicate which fields are causing quality control alerts.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per primary specimen, allowing dynamic (non-cached) calculation of typical vial counts.

ns:column.ns:description: A string value that uniquely identifies the specimen/draw-level properties of the vial, including subject, visit, and specimen type.
The total volume of all vials from each specimen that are currently available for request.
The total volume of all vials from each specimen.
The number of vials from each specimen that are currently locked in requests.
The number of vials from each specimen that are currently at a repository.
The number of vials from each specimen that are currently available for request.
The total number of vials from each specimen.
The total volume of all vials from each specimen that are expected to become available for request. This includes vials currently available as well as those not available but not yet requested.

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per defined sample availability rule. Containers without defined rules will use a default set.

ns:column.ns:description: The unique ID of the availablility rule.
The order in which this availablility rule is run within its container.
The type the availablility rule.
The data specifying how the availablility rule should be run.
The unique ID of the availablility rule.
Refresh specimens from the source study on a nightly basis
Settings used to create this snapshot study

ns:table.ns:description: Contains one row per expected assay in the study, describing which lab will run the assay and which specimen type will be used.
Contains one row per assay/visit combination, used to define the assay expectations for this study.

ns:column.ns:description: Indicates that this tag can be used for only one visit for each study/cohort combination.
